description: This simple shortbread recipe is buttery, moreish and a treat all will love.
name: Easy Butter Shortbread Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 150oC. Line 2 baking trays with baking paper.
Use an electric beater to beat the butter and sugar until pale and creamy.
Gradually add the sifted flours, beating on a low speed until almost combined. Use your hands to bring the dough together and then turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead gently until smooth.

Divide the dough into 2 equal portions. Shape 1 portion of dough into a 20cm diameter disc directly on one baking tray. You can then either pinch the edges to make a fluted design or use the round end of a butter knife (as I did). Using a sharp knife, score the disc into 8 wedges (but don't cut all the way through) and then use a fork to prick the dough all over. Do the same with the second piece of dough. Sprinkle both discs with extra sugar.

Bake the shortbread in the oven for 40 minutes, swapping the trays halfway through cooking. Let them cool on the tray for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to completely cool. They will be soft when they first come out of the oven so will need to firm up a little before you put them on the wire rack. Cut into wedges to serve.
